title: Irelia General Strategy
body: I just bought irelia, and I would like some general strategy to keep me started :).

replies.body: Buy a {{item:3078}} first large item!! that is by far the best item for her! in lane she can be played a lot of different ways, I find she can usually pop squishy champions pretty early on but with larger ones it is best to wait it out and just farm until around level 6, I like to use my q to farm minions that I would otherwise loose because killing something resets the cool down and refunds half the mana. it is best to seek out a low minion then q to it using your e to slow or stun the enemy champion if you have sheen this will activate its additional auto damage so turn on your w and just start auto attacking  until they die and if they try to get away or you need more damage you and q to them because its cool down was reset when you jumped to that low health minion. if they get to far away you can finish them with your ult. This can take a lot of practice to get right maybe 5 games or so but it is soo worth it. She can be a total monster all game and is super fun to play once you have mastered her! later on in the game you can chose to play her more of an assassin or more tank depending on the items, as an assassin you can easily jump into the back lines and just use your w and autos to do massive damage to the squishes. using the short cool down on your q and max level to jump between skill shots and cc and onto targets that are running away. as a tank you can from a solid front line and destroy their front line with your true damage while poking back their damage dealers with your ult. there are many more things you can do with her, and I think the best way is to spend some time leaning her then just try you best and you will usually come off better. have fun :)
Each use of R procs Trinity Force so if you are not spamming at range or spamming for heals consider spacing out the uses in between autos.
